headline: Kraft Heinz Pauses Split, Commits $600 Million to Revive Growth
summary: New CEO halts planned separation to reinvest in brands, despite forecast for third straight annual organic sales decline.

headline: JPMorgan downgrades Kraft Heinz after weak outlook, halting company split
summary: Investing.com -- JPMorgan downgraded Kraft Heinz to Underweight from Neutral, citing a weak 2026 earnings outlook, ongoing volume declines in North America and the risk that higher spending may take time to produce results.

headline: Here Are Thursday’s Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: BP Plc., Borg Warner, Generac, Kraft-Heinz, MercadoLibre, Pfizer, Shopify, Valvoline, and More
summary: Pre-Market Stock Futures: Futures are trading higher after a wild Wednesday that saw the market rally hard on the open on the non-farm payrolls print that blew away estimates, despite a significant decline in government jobs. However, the “buy the rumor, sell the news” cliche came in fast and strong, quickly turning the rally into ... headline: Vetnique Labs Names Noel Geoffroy as Global CEO
summary: Vetnique Labs ("Vetnique"), a leading vet-recommended pet health and wellness company, today announced that consumer industry leader Noel Geoffroy has been named Global CEO, responsible for leading the global organization. Vetnique is backed by Gryphon Investors ("Gryphon"), a leading middle-market private investment firm.

headline: The Jobs Market Looks Strong. These Warning Signs Show AI Is a Growing Threat.
summary: Jobs report complicates Trump’s rate-cut push, Ackman reveals new stakes in Meta, Amazon, and Hertz, McDonald’s affordability push is paying off, and more news to start your day.

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Jobs Up, Rate-Cut Odds Down
summary: The gains blew past consensus estimates, solidifying expectations that the Federal Reserve will keep interest rates on hold for the foreseeable future.  Employment gains were highly concentrated in healthcare and related sectors.  Kraft Heinz said it is pausing work on a planned split between its condiment and grocery-staples businesses.

headline: KHC Q4 Deep Dive: Investment Ramp and Brand Strategy Shift Take Center Stage
summary: Packaged foods company Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.4% year on year to $6.35 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.67 per share was 9.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
